channel.title: Java on Shaheer Muzammil
channel.description: Recent content in Java on Shaheer Muzammil

item.title: Recording
item.description:
A simple android voice recording application I created a while back. It has following features;

  • Record audio. Pause/Resume between a recording.
  • Control recording bitrate.
  • Save recording to local storage in a folder named Recording.
  • View, Rename or delete all recordings.

item.title: GeoTrack
item.description:
GeoTrack

GeoTrack is an Attendance monitoring and location tracking application using Google Geofences it will record user’s enterance and exit from user specific server defined Geofences. It also has a location tracking service that collects user’s location with an interval of 15 minutes and is triggered and stopped on the bases of three criterias, that are;

  • Continuous: never stops
  • Fence based trigger: starts and ends service when the person enters a particular fence.
  • Time based trigger: starts an ends service at a particular time.

Application Screens

Splash & Login

The users enter the application to a splash screen which then navigates to the login screen. The user logs in by providing Username and password.

item.title: Vesta Audit
item.description:
The application replaces manual telecom tower surveys. By digitalizing survey form data entry, syncing and report generation for multiple survey roles like Power Engineer, Civil, Design, etc.

This application was sold to MTN Nigeria and JAZZ (The largest telecom services provider in Pakistan).

item.title: Customer Insight
item.description:
Customer Insight

Customer insight was a multi language application for Telecom Industry to monitor their network user’s experience and improve customer support. The application was meant to collect user’s network performance parameters to build coverage maps and find weak areas. The application also enabled the user to run call sms and internet speed tests for runtime diagnostics.

Application Screens

The application UI was based on a View Pager an the user could swipe through the dashboard and test screens.
